summary: Ronald Adrine was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is identified as Staff Counsel with an annual salary of $27,000.00. He appears in multiple payroll reports and a final determination notification regarding HSCA staff payroll records. These documents span from November 1978 to March 1979, with a later document in December 1995 concerning the release of payroll information. The payroll reports list his name, position, and salary, while the final determination document mentions the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers from HSCA staff payroll records, including his.
significance: Ronald Adrine's significance lies in his role as Staff Counsel for the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documents highlight his employment and salary details within the committee's payroll records.
